body: Well that submitted before I was done. Give me a moment to finish this and then I'll comment again that it's ready for review.

rename.from: List formats for flags, asmflags, and gcflags
rename.to: List formats for flags, ldflags, asmflags, and gcflags

body:
Okay, we're good to go. @caarlos0, I can write up a pull request for this if you let me know which approach to take. For clarity, those are:
1. Change `ldflags`, `gcflags`, and `asmflags` to type `StringArray`, which has an `UnmarshalYAML` method that upconverts bare strings into one-element arrays, and `flags` to type `FlagsArray`, which has an `UnmarshalYAML` method that upconverts bare strings into arrays by running them through `strings.Fields()`
1. Change `ldflags`, `gcflags`, and `asmflags` to type `StringArray` and deprecate `flags` in favor of a new field called `flags_list` (or something)
1. Deprecate `flags`, `ldflags`, `gcflags`, and `asmflags` in favor of new `*_list` fields

Alternatively, a fourth approach:

4. Handle `flags` as in one of the preceding approaches and deprecate `ldflags`, `gcflags`, and `asmflags` in favor of some new fields that look like this:
    ```yaml
    gcflags_list:
    - pattern: ./sub
      args: -trimpath=/Users/eliyoung/go/src/github.com
    - args: -trimpath={{.Env.GOPATH}}
      # pattern isn't necessary here because no pattern is equivalent to '.'
    ```
    This approach has the benefit of making the pattern explicit. It doesn't need to be done on the `flags` field because arbitrary flags don't necessary support patterns.
I think that not breaking compatibility is the ideal... you can for sure open a PR, I would be glad ðŸ˜„
To be clear, all of the approaches I listed preserve compatibility. Which do you think I should implement?
sorry, the `StringArray` one seems better IMO :)

issue.title: feat: Convert flag fields into lists
issue.body:
This allows users to specify different sets of compiler, assembler, and/or linker flags for different packages. It also makes it possible to specify generic flags that contain spaces. It does this while maintaining compatibility with the old format of the fields in question by up-converting bare strings into single-element lists.

Resolves #668

body: This issue has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
